textBox.richText: Thankfully my extremely poor French can be laid to rest, as today we headed out of French speaking Quebec and arrived in the English provence of Ontario. After a sad farewell to Sarah, Lora and their partners, Steph, Felicity, James and I drove a mammoth 700 odd kilometers from Montreal to Niagara Falls. (We shouldn’t complain though as Sarah and Sean had to drive 12 hours back to Halifax) Time was tight as we were hoping to make the final Maid of the Mist at 4.45pm. James suffered the pain of driving the whole distance and due to the constraints the girls had to go without bathroom breaks!! Ouch! We ended up arriving a matter of minutes too late. After the 6 hour drive it was disappointing to miss out but we didn’t let it get us down. We took a Journey Behind the Falls which was unforgettable. After traversing a number of tunnels that wound their way behind the wall of water, open air portholes provided amazing views and the thunderous sound vibrated through the tunnel walls. We even hung around to catch a glimpse of the falls at night.
